chapter.title: System Administration
chapter.para: Before you can begin processing Time and Expense Sheets, you must first set up the system with Expense Items, create Employees, and configure appropriate User Permissions. These activities should be completed by a manager responsible for time and expenseâ€•or dedicated information technology professional. In this chapter, we'll cover the following topics:
Once these configurations are complete, you can begin entering Time and Expense Sheets!

section.title: Expense Item Setup
section.para: In order to use items for Project expenses, you need to create or edit existing reference Items and map expense accounts to the General Ledger. To demonstrate how this is done, we will use examples taken from the xTuple demo database. To begin, follow the steps below:

listitem.para: Follow this path: Products > Item > List...
Select an existing Reference item, or create a new Reference item. For this example, we'll select the MILEAGE item.

note.para: The Project tab is only available for Reference item types.

section.para: Once "Allow use as Expense Item on Projects" is checked, the Project tab provides the ability to select a specific Account OR Expense Category.

note.para: In order to track costs for a Project an account or category MUST be selected for the item.

listitem.para: Identify a General Ledger (G/L) Account to be used for expensing Purchasing Expenses to. This is an Expense Account. This Account will be used to create distributions when Vouchering expense lines. The account will be debited when the Voucher is posted.

Identify an Expense Category to distribute Purchasing Expenses to. The Expense Category is used to define a set of General Ledger (G/L) Accounts related to an expense. This Account will be used to create distributions when Vouchering expense lines. The account will be debited when the Voucher is posted.

section.title: Configuring Employees
section.para: Configuring Employees in xTuple is a critical component to time and expense since time sheets are associated with Employee. Only users that are set up as an Employee and have the correct level of permissions will have the ability to track their time.

listitem.para: To get started go to System > Employees > List....

section.para: Simply select New and complete Employee information. Once Employee record is Saved they are ready for assigned permissions.
In order to create vouchers to compensate Employees for expenses performed according to time sheet, the Employee must be selected as a vendor. Click on Detail tab and click vendor box.
Click Vendor button to enter detailed vendor information.

In order track cost of Employee time as an expense the Employee must NOT be flagged as a Contractor and the compensation field must have a value greater than zero. Select the Financial tab and the following screen will appear.

section.title: Configuring User Permissions
section.para: xTuple ERP has the powerful ability to manage user permissions, enabling you to allow or disallow access to various functional areas of the system. For example, a clerk may enter time and expense, while a manager may have the ability to Approve entries.

There are several options available to you when managing system users. You can either A) assign individual permissions to users B) create preconfigured groups of permissions and assign individuals to these groups or C) a combination of A and B.
The following path will get you to the screen for maintaining system users: System > Maintain Users.
In this scenario, let's say we have a new Employee whose permissions we want to review. To begin, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Highlight the user whose permissions we want to review
Select the EDIT button (or double-click on the user)

section.para: As you can see, the basic user information—such as name and email address—has already been entered. The user has the ability to enter their own time and expenses, which you can see under the "Granted Privileges" section. We can add or remove privileges (by module) simply by selecting a specific privilege, and then choosing either the ADD or REVOKE button.

tip.para: Use the ADD ALL and REVOKE ALL buttons to move all the privileges at once for the specified module

section.para: The user role feature makes it easy to define logical sets of privileges defined according to standard job roles. The following path takes you to the screen for defining role privileges: System > Maintain Roles. More information regarding Role setup, please consult the xTuple ERP Reference Guide.

tip.para: Time and Expense entry is closely integrated with Projects and Tasks. Users that are granted privileges to Time and Expense entry should also be granted MaintainProjects and ViewProjects in the CRM module.
